description:
I deployed a multinodes Openstack environment, including Nova, Horizon, Keystone and Glance. and create an instance associated a floating IP. Before terminate this instance, I forgot to disassociate the floating IP with this instance.  After terminated the instance, I found the floating IP cannot be available. 

All of these operation are done from Horizon. 

I recommend that when users terminate an instance, the backend of horizon can auto to disassociate the related IP and Volumes.

Any hint is appreciated. If I left out anything or make a wrong config, please feel free to correct me.
title: After terminated a instance associated with a floating IP, the floating IP will unavailable.

comments.content: IIRC the floating IP is returned to the pool after a timeout (5 minutes or so). Could you check that the failure is permanent ? Or does the floating IP become available again after a delay ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Thierry: you're thinking of fixed ips.

I believe this bug is invalid: If you terminate an instance the floating ip is disassociated from the instance. It will still be allocated to your project and can be allocated to another instance in the future.
